wirknorm.legal_consequence: Obligation to establish, implement, document and maintain a risk management system

addressee.note: Not explicit in Art 9 but clear from Section 2 context (Art 8)
addressee.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: Unclear if deployers have parallel obligations

threshold_requirements.description: Cumulative requirements that must all be fulfilled for obligation to apply

requirements.description: AI system must be classified as high-risk
requirements.note: Shared node - used by all Chapter III Section 2 obligations

requirements.description: System is placed on market or put into service (or in development phase)
requirements.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: Art 9 doesn't explicitly state timing. Art 11(1) says technical docs must exist BEFORE market placement. Art 9(2) 'throughout entire lifecycle' suggests pre-market obligation. Art 9(8) requires testing 'prior to' market placement.

substantive_obligations.description: What must be done once threshold requirements are met

core_obligation.description: Establish, implement, document and maintain risk management system

requirements.description: System must be continuous iterative process
Planned and run throughout entire lifecycle
Regular systematic review and updating required
Identification and analysis of known and reasonably foreseeable risks to health, safety or fundamental rights when used according to intended purpose

interpretative_elements.note: Requires contextual judgment about what risks are 'reasonably foreseeable'

requirements.description: Estimation and evaluation of risks during intended purpose use and under reasonably foreseeable misuse
requirements.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'reasonably foreseeable misuse' requires contextual interpretation

interpretative_elements.note: Highly context-dependent - what constitutes foreseeable misuse varies by system type, deployment context, user sophistication

requirements.description: Evaluation of risks arising from post-market monitoring data

dependencies.note: Requires provider to have established post-market monitoring system

requirements.description: Adoption of appropriate and targeted risk management measures to address identified risks

scope_limitation.description: Only risks that may be reasonably mitigated or eliminated through development/design or provision of adequate technical information
scope_limitation.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'reasonably mitigated' is interpretative. What about risks inherent to the use case itself that cannot be designed out?

risk_management_measures.description: Requirements for the measures adopted in step (d)

requirements.description: Measures shall consider effects and interaction of combined requirements in Section 2
requirements.note: Must balance measures to fulfill multiple requirements

requirements.description: Residual risk must be judged acceptable
requirements.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'acceptable' is highly interpretative - no defined threshold

interpretative_elements.note: Requires risk-benefit analysis, consideration of state of art, sector-specific norms

requirements.description: Three-tier hierarchy of risk management measures

measures.description: Elimination or reduction of risks through adequate design and development
measures.requirement: Eliminate/reduce in as far as technically feasible

measures.description: Implementation of adequate mitigation and control measures for risks that cannot be eliminated
Provision of information (Article 13) and training to deployers

requirements.description: Must consider technical knowledge, experience, education, training expected of deployer and presumable context of use
requirements.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: Requires judgment about deployer capabilities and context

requirements.description: Systems shall be tested to identify appropriate risk management measures
Testing must ensure consistent performance for intended purpose and compliance with Section 2 requirements
Testing may include real-world conditions per Article 60
Testing at any time during development, and in any event prior to market placement/service

requirements.timing: prior to market placement or putting into service

requirements.description: Testing against predefined metrics and probabilistic thresholds appropriate to intended purpose
requirements.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'appropriate' thresholds is interpretative - varies by use case, risk level, sector

vulnerable_groups.description: Consideration of impact on vulnerable groups

requirements.description: Consider whether system likely to adversely impact persons under 18
As appropriate, consider other vulnerable groups
requirements.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'other vulnerable groups' is open-ended, 'as appropriate' is discretionary

integration_provision.description: Risk management may be integrated with procedures under other Union law

shared_nodes_identified.description: Determination of whether AI system is high-risk
Concept of 'intended purpose' of AI system
Temporal trigger: placing on market or putting into service
Obligation to provide information to deployers

low_confidence_flags.issue: Article 9 doesn't explicitly state 'provider' as addressee - inferred from context
Unclear if obligation arises before market placement or only upon placement
What about risks inherent to use case that cannot be designed out?
No defined threshold for 'acceptable' - requires interpretation
Context-dependent determination of appropriate testing thresholds

next_steps: Map Article 6 (high-risk classification) as foundational dependency
Review low-confidence flags with legal expert
Define LLM evaluation parameters for interpretative elements
